Class EventRow

java.lang.Object
com.example.ajilore.code.ui.events.list.EventRow
public class EventRow extends Object
Model representing a single event row in the events feed, used by adapters for display.

  • Field Summary

    Fields
    Modifier and Type
    Field
    Description
    final String
    dateText
    Formatted date string (pre-formatted for view).
    final String
    id
    Firestore document ID for the event.
    final String
    location
    Location string for the event.
    final int
    posterRes
    Drawable resource ID for poster thumbnail.
    final String
    posterUrl
    Poster Cloudinary URL (if image is remote), or null.
    final String
    status
    Status label (e.g., "Open", "Closed").
    final String
    title
    Main event title for display.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    EventRow(String id, String title, String location, String dateText, int posterRes, String posterUrl, String status)
    Constructs a new immutable event row for display in the feed.

      Main event title for display.

      Location string for the event.

  • Constructor Details

    • EventRow

      public EventRow(String id, String title, String location, String dateText, int posterRes, String posterUrl, String status)
      Constructs a new immutable event row for display in the feed.
      Parameters:
      id - Firestore doc ID of the event.
      title - Event title.
      location - Event location.
      dateText - Pre-formatted date and/or time.
      posterRes - Drawable res ID for thumbnail; used as fallback.
      posterUrl - Remote URL to image (Cloudinary or similar); may be null.
      status - String status to show in UI chips, e.g., "Open" or "Closed".
